title: Knettishall Heath Country Park Walking Route

nearby.description: Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path

images.title: Simon Peck / Dew Pond on Knettishall Heath
images.caption: Dew Pond on Knettishall Heath. A small pond in the enclosure set aside for Exmoor Ponies on the heath.

images.title: Angles Way, by Knettishall Heath Country Park by Robert Edwards, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Angles Way, by Knettishall Heath Country Park

images.title: Bob Jones / River Little Ouse at Knettishall
images.caption: River Little Ouse at Knettishall. The river passes under a bridge and then over this weir, adjacent to the car park at the country park.

images.title: Stephen McKay / Knettishall Heath
images.caption: The park preserves the traditional heath land of this part of East Anglia.

images.title: Ian M / Knettishall Heath Country Park
images.caption: Bridge over the Little Ouse River

images.title: Keith Evans / Starting Point Of The Peddars Way
images.caption: Starting Point Of The Peddars Way in the park, This is the start of the long distance footpath Peddars Way. The finger post says Peddars Way Holme Next to Sea 46 miles. Near to Rushford, Norfolk.

description: This delightful open space near Thetford is the start point for three of Britain's best long distance walks:- the Icknield Way Path, the Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path, and the Angles Way. At Knettishall you'll find 430 acres of woodland and riverside meadows, as well as large areas of heath. The park has a number of lovely woodland and heathland footpaths with views of the Little Ouse River.
